FuncDef:
The service-instance-group command binds a DS-Lite instance to a service-instance-group instance group.
The undo service-instance-group command deletes the binding between a DS-Lite instance and a service-instance-group instance group.
By default, a DS-Lite instance is bound to no service-instance-group instance group.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a service-instance-group instance group.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Service-location backup groups can be bound to a service-instance-group instance group. A DS-Lite instance must be bound to a service-instance-group instance group before DS-Lite services are properly transmitted.
Precautions
DS-Lite dynamic load balancing is not supported in distributed DS-Lite scenarios and is mutually exclusive with the common address pool, DS-Lite server function, and port-forwarding function.
NAT dynamic load balancing is mutually exclusive with a common IP address pool, NAT server function, easy IP, port-forwarding, and an overloaded address pool.
